title: Who can fully clear the jungle and how long does it take?
body:
{{champion:20}} {{item:1041}}  3:50
{{champion:64}} {{item:1041}} 3:55
{{champion:90}} {{item:1039}} 3:58
{{champion:72}} {{item:1041}} 3:59
{{champion:77}} {{item:1041}} 4:00
{{champion:48}} {{item:1041}} 4:03
{{champion:31}} {{item:1039}}  4:04
{{champion:131}} {{item:1039}} 4:05
{{champion:19}} {{item:1041}}  4:17
{{champion:106}} {{item:1041}}  4:19




I'm still trying to find the fastest ways for each jungler, and still trying to figure out what other champions can clear all the camps without dying. Help would be appreciated.

replies.body: {{champion:48}} {{item:1041}} ive been doing this i dont know the exact time but its pretty fast. i also use {{champion:10}} and {{champion:76}} but they arent as quick
Trundle is a hidden OP jungler, his entire kit revolves around close quarters combat and sustained fighting. I love playing the Troll King, have you played him yet with the pre-season changes?

> [{quoted}](name=Gunslinger744,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=lFR4beMQ,comment-id=00070000,timestamp=2015-11-15T22:08:59.165+0000)
>
> Trundle is a hidden OP jungler, his entire kit revolves around close quarters combat and sustained fighting. I love playing the Troll King, have you played him yet with the pre-season changes?

I've tried him several times, but I got killed by the fourth or third camp. I KNOW I'm doing it wrong, but I'm not sure how. Mind giving me some advice so I can put him on the list?

You should make sure that you use Q as an autoattack reset to maximize damage.

If you are having trouble sustaining, then it might be better to save your W until you can kill the large monster before it ends.  That way your passive will heal you more.

Are you using the Refillable Potion or 3 Health Potions?  I would highly suggest the latter.

> [{quoted}](name=EndlessSorcerer,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=lFR4beMQ,comment-id=0007000000000000,timestamp=2015-11-15T23:35:34.685+0000)
>
> You should make sure that you use Q as an autoattack reset to maximize damage.
> 
> If you are having trouble sustaining, then it might be better to save your W until you can kill the large monster before it ends.  That way your passive will heal you more.
> 
> Are you using the Refillable Potion or 3 Health Potions?  I would highly suggest the later.

I do use Q as an auto attack reset, and I also always go with 3 health potions, since that gives more initial sustain than Refillable Potion, and you really need all the sustain you can if you want to clear all the camps.

However, I've forgotten about Trundle's passive, and so only use my W when I'm healing from potions or right before I smite the Red Brambleback, although I smite it to finish it off so I unintentionally make good use of my passive anyway.

Also, correct me if I'm wrong but it's better to start Krugz first, right?
I've found myself going Krugs (smite), Raptors, Red Buff (smite) on most junglers for the health sustain and damage reduction.  After that, I just continue on the other side of my jungle.
Hey another note for both of you, Trundles W can also be used as an auto attack reset.

Another tip: apparently Trundle can still solo both Red and Blue buffs at level 1 without Smite.

Runes: Attack Speed Quints, AD Marks, Armor Seals, MR Glyphs
Masteries: 18/0/12
Starting Items: Doran's Blade, Health Potion

It's not as effective as it was last season since you don't hit level 2 (and you may lose more minions, not sure), but stealing an enemy jungler's buff at level 1 and having it for laning phase is pretty good.
Good to know!

{{champion:19}} with {{item:1039}} ??????????
are you trolling?
WW is on-hit based and you don't take machete?

> [{quoted}](name=Ipols,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=lFR4beMQ,comment-id=000d,timestamp=2015-11-15T22:34:29.659+0000)
>
> {{champion:19}} with {{item:1039}} ??????????
> are you trolling?
> WW is on-hit based and you don't take machete?

Fuck. I didn't think of that. All I remembered is that he's pretty mana hungry with his Q and everything. I'm gonna revisit him later today and update how long it took.

Nah he's not even mana hungry, if you care that's how I do on WW:

krugs start:
take Q, wait to use it untill you took a bit of dmg to not waste the heal and smite the krugs after they hit you twice;
take W, kill red and run to scuttle crub if you want to do it since you have to use your stun on the golem buff if you don't want to waste a minute following the fucker.
level 3 take the second point in W, then max R>Q>W>E

gromp start is basically the same but if you chose to do scuttle it'll take a lot, I'd smite it since you don't need to smite blue, so you can go:
krugs->blue->wolves->scuttle (smite)
What golems? Do you mean Gromp? If so Gromp is near blue??? What?
I think he was meaning Krugs>Red>Crab since Krugs used to be small golems.
messed up the camps names because I had to sleep! edited now, thanks

> [{quoted}](name=iguy,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=lFR4beMQ,comment-id=000d000000000000,timestamp=2015-11-16T00:00:51.852+0000)
>
> What golems? Do you mean Gromp? If so Gromp is near blue??? What?

I think he means the Blue Sentinel. I usually think of it as a Golem myself.

In case you don't know, different variations of Golems used to be in place of the Blue Sentinel and Krugz.
Ok, thanks.

you are level 27, that explains it xD

The blue buff used to be a big golem, and the krugs used to be little golems. But it all changed when the SRU attacked.

You don't use Q on jungle WW... You max W first and you can put 1 point into Q if you really feel you need the sustain, but you always max E after W and disregard Q. The extra movement speed is essential.
I can't tell you exact cleartimes, but I regularly clear the full jungle with {{champion:9}} and {{champion:203}}
{{champion:26}} {{item:1039}} ?
{{champion:26}}  Ends up in the previous game after clearing the jungle

Check out stonewall008's channel, he made a bunch of videos and he usually knows the best runes/masteries for each champ.

EDIT:

 https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLOz__Qlgs1sL-EpuLp2BSLgE4cWJ7Hi8y

Also this Facebook post of stonewall where he shared good masteries

Can we please nerf lee sin, i'm sorry, but no matter what happens to the jungle lee sin is just "never" bad

> [{quoted}](name=TheInnocentdevil,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=lFR4beMQ,comment-id=002c,timestamp=2015-11-16T02:31:45.063+0000)
>
> Can we please nerf lee sin, i'm sorry, but no matter what happens to the jungle lee sin is just "never" bad

Pretty sure you can say the same for Amumu.

Amumu is never bad at a casual level.

Lee is never bad at both a competitive and casual level

He's also almost always good at a competitive level, while Amumu is almost always bad.
No idea why people see that as a problem unless hes top tier. Theres no reason champs have to spend an equal amount of time being useless

Trundle can. Clear speed usually depends on if he starts red or blue. With red, he can go a lot faster.

{{champion:54}} {{item:1039}} can do REALLY well if you start Krugs. Krugs->Raptors->Red->Blue. Start E, level E a second time at 3. Start with armor marks and seals. You'll clear sorta slow, but you can do it without 4:10-4:15ish without a problem with health, but ONLY if you do red AFTER Raptors since that'll give you the time you need to smite it.
{{champion:90}} cleared the jungle the fastest and got first blood before my first back. Then proceeded to die a ton because i had no mana pots to cast spells and azir kept taking my blue.

> [{quoted}](name=Stephenizgod,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=lFR4beMQ,comment-id=0006,timestamp=2015-11-15T19:29:10.623+0000)
>
> {{champion:90}} cleared the jungle the fastest and got first blood before my first back. Then proceeded to die a ton because i had no mana pots to cast spells and azir kept taking my blue.

I have no idea how you did it with him. I killed blue and gromp and then I died.

> [{quoted}](name=Wind Whistler,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=lFR4beMQ,comment-id=00060001,timestamp=2015-11-15T20:43:42.061+0000)
>
> I have no idea how you did it with him. I killed blue and gromp and then I died.

I can finish a full clear at full health with a potion left over because his sustain is so sexy.

Get yourr passive ready to proc before leaving base, then cast Q to spawn the voidling at 1:33 so it becomes stage 2 by the time buffs spawn. When they do, make sure your minion stays alive, but let him tank as much damage as possible. Repeat this process until you start to have 2 up at every camp and proceed to clear camps while taking no damage at all.

He is able to level 3 drag if you know how. its tricky but look up Aquadragon33's ad malz jungle guide. He was the highest ranking malzahar NA for a while. Was playing AD jungle malz in master tier....

> [{quoted}](name=TheWoollyMammoth,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=lFR4beMQ,comment-id=0006000100010001,timestamp=2015-11-16T00:08:15.520+0000)
>
> He is able to level 3 drag if you know how. its tricky but look up Aquadragon33's ad malz jungle guide. He was the highest ranking malzahar NA for a while. Was playing AD jungle malz in master tier....

I never knew he had a youtube account. I remember reading one of his comments about a year and a half ago saying that he got picked on for playing strange things like AD jungle Malzahar, even though he made it into diamond (this was before Master Tier existed). Thanks for refreshing my memory.
Anytime!
meanwhile fucking {{champion:104}} soloing baron after {{item:3072}} {{item:3031}}
Doubt he can solo it that early with shit attack speed.
Stonewall on youtube has a ton of jng clear videos. https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLOz__Qlgs1sL-EpuLp2BSLgE4cWJ7Hi8y

{{champion:9}} can for sure even with no leash nor armor runes, but I haven't taken the time.
He doesn't upgrade {{item:1039}} , instead rushing some mana regen first (one of {{item:3070}} {{item:3028}} {{item:3027}} or a few {{item:1056}} ) and {{item:3157}} immediately after that.



{{champion:98}} {{champion:5}} {{champion:64}} {{champion:107}}  should be able too, but I haven't actually tried them this preseason.

> [{quoted}](name=Esthlos,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=lFR4beMQ,comment-id=0009,timestamp=2015-11-15T20:51:20.367+0000)
>
> {{champion:9}} can for sure even with no leash nor armor runes, but I haven't taken the time.
> He doesn't upgrade {{item:1039}} , instead rushing some mana regen first (one of {{item:3070}} {{item:3028}} {{item:3027}} or a few {{item:1056}} ) and {{item:3157}} immediately after that.
> 
> 
> 
> {{champion:98}} {{champion:5}} {{champion:64}} {{champion:107}}  should be able too, but I haven't actually tried them this preseason.

I'm one of those people who forgot about {{champion:9}} , lol. Also, {{champion:107}} 's winrate has dropped by a bit, so I wouldn't be surprised if this was because he has a harder time clearing the jungle. Not sure about Lee Sin or Shen though.

shen does well
I went {{item:1041}} > {{item:3751}} > {{item:1413}} 
Bami's cinder before upgrading the smite because otherwise his clears become super slow as the jungle camps level. And cinder gives combat stats since you should be gank heavy anyways.

AS reds, HP Seals, scaling MR Glyphs, Armor Quints. http://prntscr.com/938otw <--masteries

He isnt the fastest clear speed, but usually you are going to want to do a level 2 gank to get a lane ahead, and then just clear camps while watching for other (counter)gank opportunities.

Try Talisman/Potion start, and Blue (smite at 240 mana), Wolves, Red (smite), Raptors, Krugs (smite). With no leash, I can get 700 gold and back at 3:40 for tracker's knife item upgrade. Runes / skill order might make a bit difference, but worst case you can learn how long you need your red buff to heal you before starting Krugs.
Don't have the times but Yi with machete and Amumu with talisman can (includes both scuttles)
Din't riot say jungle would be easier? so you should not have to do those test to figure out who wont die in the jungle right?

My only tip is to never ever start Refillable Potion. It gives way less sustain that 3 Health Potions for the same gold. Yes, it upgrades to Hunter's Potion but I rarely find myself needing more sustain after buying my jungle item, and stop buying Health Potions anyway. I only think Hunter's Potion is useful on champions with no innate sustain like {{champion:32}} who also want to top up their mana. Even on {{champion:33}} who has no way to heal up, I don't bother with it, because he takes so little damage that the sustain from your jungle item is enough.

{{champion:29}} {{summoner:11}} {{summoner:7}} 5:05 (start red; kills scuttle instead of gromp)
{{champion:48}} {{item:1041}} {{item:2031}}  4:03
{{champion:48}} {{item:1039}} {{item:2010}}  4:12
{{champion:104}} {{item:1041}} 4:18
{{champion:421}} {{item:1041}} 4:12
{{champion:39}} {{item:1041}} {{item:2010}} 4:25
I only tried a single run through with each of these, so you can probably improve on the listed times.
Masteries were 18-6-6.

{{champion:121}} {{item:1041}} Has to base after blue buff (before red)
{{champion:121}} {{item:1039}} Can't kill blue buff (or JUST barely kills it with perfect timings)

Thing is he cleared whatever side he wanted just fine last patch. Now I can barely get through early game (the only game) sometimes and need a hella hard leash. I could have just gotten worse at clearing with Kha suddenly or something but this is disappointing :(
Same with Nidalee, her early clear is atrocious now

Master Yi
{{item:1041}} {{item:2031}} 
Q->E->W->W skill order (then max R>Q>E>W)
if blue side gromp (smite) -> blue -> wolves -> krugs (smite) -> red -> wraiths
red side krugs (smite)-> red -> wraiths -> gromp (smite) -> blue -> wolves
Don't know the exact time though

{{champion:77}} {{item:1041}} : 4:00 
or if you do talisman it took me about: 4:15
{{champion:64}} {{item:1041}} : 3:55

I like using attaack speed runes 

20 armor 
20% attack speed on udyr 


Shyvana can with machete of course it took me 
about 3:45


a full built yasuo can do it in 30 seconds and most of it is walking to camps. 
(but thats just me dicking around)


{{champion:5}} {{champion:111}} {{champion:98}} {{champion:11}} {{champion:54}} {{champion:36}} 
Some of them you have to be very cautious 
Wukong will take a bit to master clearing w/out death. if your team needs help first 5 minutes of the game.. screw them.. I spend 7-15 minutes power farming
*sometimes in enemy jungle*

Because if you cant get farmed up you are obviously useless.  

But, the above champs are ones who can clear jungle fully without dying if done right :) 

{{champion:32}} {{champion:60}} {{champion:23}} = I know they can 


try them out !  Happy Ganking!
